page.title: 01LANDSCAPE CUBERT/HOLYWELL
page.content:
The ancient parish of Cubert is situated on a rise of a gently rolling landscape. From the church there are commanding views to the south of Penhale Sands, an extensive area of sand dunes largely occupied by Penhale Army Training Camp. To the west lies Holywell Bay with its magnificent beach and associated tourist attactions which makes this a most popular area for summer holiday makers.
The National Trust owns an area of 2000 acres to the north known as Cubert Common. The remaining land is farmed. In the last 10 years there has been considerable housing development. A new extension to the school was opened in l977 and in l98l a new village hall was built.
